!GitHub1s github1s One second to read GitHub code with VS Code. Usage Just add after and press in the browser address bar for any repository you want to read. For example, try it on the VS Code repo: https://github1s.com/microsoft/vscode !VS Code - GitHub1s You can also use https://gitlab1s.com or https://npmjs1s.com in the same way. For browser extensions, see Third-party Related Projects. Or save the following code snippet as a bookmarklet, you can use it to quickly switch between github.com and github1s.com GitHub markdown doesn't allow js links, so just copy it into a bookmark. Develop in the cloud To edit files, run Docker containers, create pull requests and more, click the "Develop your project on Gitpod" button in the status bar. You can also open the Command Palette default shortcut and choose . !Gitpod Status Bar Documentation - How it works - Roadmap Enabling Private Repositories If you want to view non-public repositories, you need to add an OAuth token. The token is stored only in your browser, and only send to GitHub when fetching your repository's files. Click on the icon near the bottom of the left-hand row of icons, and the dialog box will prompt you for it, and even take you to your GitHub settings page to generate one, if needed. <img height="500px" src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/conwnet/github1s/master/resources/images/auth-token.png" /> Screenshots !VS Code - GitHub1s !VS Code - GitHub1s Development Cloud-based development You can start an online development environment with Gitpod by clicking the following button: !Gitpod ready-to-codehttps://gitpod.io/https://github.com/conwnet/github1s Local development Local development with full VS Code build You need these prerequisites the same ones as for VS Code for development with full VS Code build. Please make sure you could build VS Code locally before the watch mode. To verify the build: After the initial successful build, you could use the watch mode: ... or ... VS Code + Docker Development You can use the VS Code plugin Remote-Containers to use a Docker container as a development environment. 1. Install the Remote-Containers plugin in VS Code & Docker 2. Open the Command Palette default shortcut and choose 3. Enter the repo, in this case or your forked repo 4. Pick either, or - Now VS Code will create the docker container and connect to the new container so you can use this as a fully setup environment! 5. Open a new VS Code Terminal, then you can run the commands listed above. Format all codes It uses to format all possible codes. Build Feedback - If something is not working, create an issue Sponsors The continued development and maintenance of GitHub1s is made possible by these generous sponsors: <table><tbody><tr> <td><a href="https://sourcegraph.com/"> <img height="40px" src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/conwnet/github1s/master/resources/images/sourcegraph-logo.svg"> </a></td> </tr></tbody></table> Partners We are partnered with OSS Insight to get the Trending Repositories & some more Interesting Analytics. OSS Insight provides deep insights into GitHub repos, developers, and curated repo lists from billions of GitHub events. It‚Äôs built with TiDB Cloud. <table><tbody><tr> <td><a href="https://ossinsight.io/?utmsource=github1s&utmmedium=github&utmcampaign=ghtrending"> <img height="40px" src="./resources/images/ossinsight-brand-dark.png"> </a></td> </tr></tbody></table> Maintainers!
